Mihir Kulkarni

I'm a graduate student at the University of Southern California, Los Angeles. I am delighted to be working in the CPS-Vida lab led by Prof. Jyo Deshmukh and collaborating with Prof. Erdem Biyik.

I am interested in Machine learning, Reinforcement learning and Foundation Models and their applicability to Robotics and Multi-agent Systems.

Prior to my graduate studies at USC, I was working at Thelios AI as a Computer Vision Engineer. I recieved by Bachelor's in Engineering in Electronics and Telecommunication at the Pune Institute of Computer Technology, India.

Email  /  CV  /  Github  /  LinkedIn

Projects
Intent inference and communication methods in Human-robot collaboration
Yachuan Hsu, Mihir Kulkarni, Erdem Biyik

This project involves analyzing and imitating human behavior in the Overcooked AI domain using PPO, SAC, and training robot policies that infer intent of the human and adapt for best team performance.

Multi-agent Path Finding
Merve Atasever, Mihir Kulkarni, Jyotirmoy Deshmukh

This problem involves planning collision-free paths for multiple robots on 2D grid world. We are developing decentralized, learning-based solutions for this problem.

Monopoly++: Collaborative Monopoly using Deep Reinforcement Learning
Mihir Kulkarni, Prerana Shenoy, Anjali Masur, Deepayan Sur , Shreya Koyande, Saloni Patadia,

report / code

Competitive and Collaborative (mixed) environment for studying natural Multi-agent Collaboration in games.
Multi-Object Tracking for Football
Mihir Kulkarni, Sunil Kulkarni

video

Player Tracking for Football is hard with Monocular camera because objects are small, fast and occlusion-prone. Our novel approach solved this problem for our specific use-case
